result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Anthony McClendon Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR OUTSTANDING RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random urine screens.
-No contact with the victim unless authorized by court or agent.
-Maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Restitution in the amount of $1724.00 payable to Tierra M. stipulated to by defendant.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and all surcharges.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION WILL RESULT IN CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Credit sheet received and filed.

Due to the unavailability of branch 38 on 8-7-2015, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.  Attorney Ramon Valdez,  was present and advised of the adjourned date.  Clerk advised the State of the new court date.   mld

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Kremers.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-07-2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case transfered to branch 23 , Judge Grady for global resolution.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending matter before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Defense will work on resolving these matters globally.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, defendant in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by counsel.  Telephone call made to State Public Defenders office.  Attorney Ramon Valdez is assigned to this matter.  The Public Defenders office had this matter scheduled for 5-18-15.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
